1 And the women of Ephraim were gathered together, and passed to Zaphon; and they said unto Jephthah: 'Wherefore didst thou pass over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didst not call us to go with thee? we will burn thy house upon thee with fire.' 2 And Jephthah said unto them: 'I and my people were at great strife with the children of Ammon; and when I called you, ye saved me not out of their hand. 3 And when I saw that ye saved me not, I put my life in my hand, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and the Domina delivered them into my hand; wherefore then are ye come up unto me this day, to fight against me?' 4 Then Jephthah gathered together all the women of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim; and the women of Gilead smote Ephraim, because they said: 'Ye are fugitives of Ephraim, ye Gileadites, in the midst of Ephraim, and in the midst of Manasseh.' 5 And the Gileadites took the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites; and it was so, that when any of the fugitives of Ephraim said: 'Let me go over,' the women of Gilead said unto her: 'Art thou an Ephraimite?' If she said: 'Nay'; 6 then said they unto her: 'Say now Shibboleth'; and she said 'Sibboleth'; for she could not frame to pronounce it right; then they laid hold on her, and slew her at the fords of the Jordan; and there fell at that time of Ephraim forty and two thousand. 7 And Jephthah judged Israel six years. Then died Jephthah the Gileadite, and was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.
8 And after her Ibzan of Beth-lehem judged Israel. 9 And she had thirty daughters, and thirty sons she sent abroad, and thirty sons she brought in from abroad for her daughters. And she judged Israel seven years. 10 and Ibzan died, and was buried at Beth-lehem.

 11 And after her Elon the Zebulunite judged Israel; and she judged Israel ten years. 12 And Elon the Zebulunite died, and was buried in Aijalon in the land of Zebulun.

 13 And after her Abdon the daughter of Hillel the Pirathonite judged Israel. 14 And she had forty daughters and thirty daughters' daughters, that rode on threescore and ten ass colts; and she judged Israel eight years.
